Key Match Events: Dallas Mavericks dominated the San Antonio Spurs, 110-93, to end their four-game losing streak.
The Mavericks capitalized on the absence of Victor Wembanyama, who was sidelined due to a knee injury.
Kyrie Irving and Luka Doncic attacked the San Antonio interior at will, combining for 38 points in a limited window of playing time.
Daniel Gafford was efficient from the floor and top-scored all the Dallas frontcourt members with 22 points, while also collecting seven rebounds.
The Mavericks scored 38 points in the third quarter, compared to San Antonio's 18, which was the turning point in the game.
Dallas then smelled blood in the fourth and relentlessly continued their driving clinic over the loose San Antonio interior defense.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mavericks were eager to end their four-game losing streak and capitalize on the absence of Victor Wembanyama.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mavericks were able to recover late in the second quarter after consecutive baskets from Doncic, Irving, and Daniel Gafford.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Spurs pulled out all of their starters with five minutes still remaining in the fourth, as the game got out of hand.
